Article.Abstract: The spike (S) protein of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus (SARS-CoV) is not only responsible for receptor binding and virus fusion, but also a major Ag among the SARS-CoV proteins that induces protective Ab responses. In this study, we showed that the S protein of SARS-CoV is highly immunogenic during infection and immunizations, and contains five linear immunodominant sites (sites I to V) as determined by Pepscan analysis with a set of synthetic peptides overlapping the entire S protein sequence against the convalescent sera from SARS patients and antisera from small animals immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV. Site IV located in the middle region of the S protein (residues 528-635) is a major immunodominant epitope. The synthetic peptide S(603-634), which overlaps the site IV sequence reacted with all the convalescent sera from 42 SARS patient, but none of the 30 serum samples from healthy blood donors, suggesting its potential application as an Ag for developing SARS diagnostics. This study also provides information useful for designing SARS vaccines and understanding the SARS pathogenesis.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification of immunodominant sites on the spike protein of severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus: implication for developing SARS diagnostics and vaccines.
Article.Affiliations: Lindsley F. Kimball Research Institute, New York Blood Center, New York, NY 10021, USA.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was cited in Li et. al. Nature 426 (6965), 450-454 (2003) [PMID:14647384].

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 10 Âµg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: BALB/c mice were immunized intradermally with 10 ug of purified viral particles (SARS coronavirus strain BJ01) inactivated by beta-propiolactone as immunogen in the presence of CFA, and boosted with freshly prepared emulsion of the immunogen and IFA at 2-wk intervals. Antisera were collected 5 days after the third boost immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from mice immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the mouse antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.
The number of positive responders is approximate.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: NZW rabbits were immunized intradermally with 30 ug of purified viral particles (SARS coronavirus strain BJ01) inactivated by beta-propiolactone as immunogen in the presence of CFA, and boosted with freshly prepared emulsion of the immunogen and IFA at 2-wk intervals. Antisera were collected 5 days after the third boost immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from rabbits immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the rabbit antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.
The number of positive responders is approximate.

Antisera were collected 5 days after the third boost immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from rabbits immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the rabbit antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.
The number of positive responders is approximate.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 10 Âµg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: BALB/c mice were immunized intradermally with 10 ug of purified viral particles (SARS coronavirus strain BJ01) inactivated by beta-propiolactone as immunogen in the presence of CFA, and boosted with freshly prepared emulsion of the immunogen and IFA at 2-wk intervals. Antisera were collected 5 days after the third boost immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from mice immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the mouse antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was cited in Li et. al. Nature 426 (6965), 450-454 (2003) [PMID:14647384].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from mice immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the mouse antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was cited in Li et. al. Nature 426 (6965), 450-454 (2003) [PMID:14647384].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The number of positive responders is approximate. This peptide is located at one of the 5 immunodominant sites.

Antisera were collected 5 days after the third boost immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from mice immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the mouse antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 30 Âµg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: NZW rabbits were immunized intradermally with 30 ug of purified viral particles (SARS coronavirus strain BJ01) inactivated by beta-propiolactone as immunogen in the presence of CFA, and boosted with freshly prepared emulsion of the immunogen and IFA at 2-wk intervals. Antisera were collected 5 days after the third boost immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from rabbits immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the rabbit antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was cited in Li et. al. Nature 426 (6965), 450-454 (2003) [PMID:14647384].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from rabbits immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the rabbit antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was cited in Li et. al. Nature 426 (6965), 450-454 (2003) [PMID:14647384].

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 10 Âµg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.

Antisera were collected 5 days after the third boost immunization.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from mice immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the mouse antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.
The number of positive responders is approximate.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis against antisera from rabbits immunized with inactivated SARS-CoV was performed. Reactivity of the rabbit antisera at 1/100 dilution with peptides overlapping the entire sequence of the S protein was measured by ELISA.
The number of positive responders is approximate.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The epitope sequence was cited in Li et. al. Nature 426 (6965), 450-454 (2003) [PMID:14647384].

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The number of positive responders is approximate.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 3 doses of 30 Âµg, administered at intervals of 2 weeks.
